obj/glb/

glb_intersect.pro


Routines

top glb_intersect

NV/LIB/GLB

result = glb_intersect(gbd, v, r, hit=hit, near=near, far=far, discriminant=discriminant, nosolve=nosolve, valid=valid)

Computes the intersection of rays with GLOBE objects.

Return value

Array (2*nv,3,nt) of points in the BODY frame, where int_pts[0:nv-1,*,*] correspond to the near-side intersections and int_pts[nv:2*nv-1,*,1] correspond to the far side. Zero vector is returned for points with no solution. STATUS: Complete

Parameters

gbd in

Array (nt) of any subclass of GLOBE descriptors.

v in

Array (nv,3,nt) giving ray origins in the BODY frame.

r in

Array (nv,3,nt) giving ray directions in the BODY frame.

Keywords

hit in

Array giving the indices of rays the hit the object.

near in

If set, only the "near" points are returned. More specifically, these points correspond to the furthest along the ray from the observer to the globe. If the observer is exterior, these are the nearest interesections to the observer; if the observer is interior, these intersections are behind the observer.

far in

If set, only the "far" points are returned. See above; if the observer is exterior, these are the furthest interesections from the observer; if the observer is interior, these intersections are in front of the observer.

discriminant

Discriminant of the quadriatic equation used to determine the intersections.

nosolve in

If set, the intersections are not computed, though the discrimiant is.

valid in

Array in which each element indicates whether the object was hit.

Author information

History:

Written by: Spitale, 1/1998 Adapted by: Spitale, 5/2016
